SEARCH
Package Weather.ui

Class Colors

java.lang.Object
Weather.ui.Colors
public class Colors extends Object
This class represents a color scheme for the weather application. It provides two ways to create a `Colors` object: 1. Based on the current weather conditions (daytime/nighttime and description). 2. By specifying specific colors for the primary, secondary, and text colors.

  • Constructor Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • Colors

      public Colors(boolean isDayTime, String description)
      Creates a `Colors` object based on the current weather conditions (daytime/nighttime and description). This constructor determines the primary and secondary colors based on the provided weather description and whether it's daytime or nighttime.
      Parameters:
      isDayTime - True if it's daytime, False if nighttime.
      description - The weather description (e.g., "clear", "rainy", "cloudy").

    • Colors

      public Colors(Color primaryColor, Color secondaryColor, Color textColor)
      Creates a `Colors` object with specific colors for primary, secondary, and text. This constructor allows you to provide pre-defined colors for the color scheme.
      Parameters:
      primaryColor - The primary color for the scheme.
      secondaryColor - The secondary color for the scheme.
      textColor - The text color for the UI elements.

  • Method Details

    • setPrimaryColor

      Sets the primary color for the scheme.
      Parameters:
      primaryColor - The new primary color.
